educational.title: Educational Report
educational.purpose: Reports on educational facilities, programs, or learning initiatives within your organization.

introduction.label: A: Introduction
introduction.purpose: State the purpose and scope of the report.
phrases: The aim of this report is to assess [topic] and suggest improvements.
This report looks at [topic] in order to identify what works well and what needs improving.
The purpose of this report is to evaluate [topic] for [group/audience].
This report provides an overview of [topic], focusing on strengths and weaknesses.

sources.label: B: Sources/Context
phrases: The report is based on feedback from [students/participants] and my own observations.
The information was collected through a short survey of [students/visitors].
The findings come from comments made by [group] during [event/time period].
This report is based on interviews with [group] and informal feedback.

general_praising_criticising.label: C: General View / Praising / Criticising
general_praising_criticising.purpose: Present overall impressions, strengths, and weaknesses.
phrases: Overall, most people felt that [topic] was [positive/negative].
On the whole, respondents were satisfied with [aspect].
One thing that worked really well was [positive point].
A definite strength was [strength].
The highlight was [best part], which many people mentioned.
However, a common complaint was that [problem].
One major issue was [issue], mainly because [reason].
[aspect] was not ideal, especially when [situation/example].
This seems to be caused by [cause], which affects [result].

recommendation.label: D: Recommendation
phrases: To improve [aspect], it would be a good idea to [suggestion].
One simple way to fix this would be to [action].
It is recommended that [action] is introduced to deal with [issue].
If this change is made, it would help [group] because [benefit].
Another option would be to [alternative], which could reduce [problem].
A practical step would be to [step], leading to [benefit].

conclusion.label: E: Conclusion
conclusion.purpose: Summarise key points and final thoughts.
phrases: In conclusion, [topic] works well overall, but [area] needs improvement.
To sum up, the main strengths are [strengths], while the biggest issue is [issue].
Taking everything into account, the most important improvement would be [key recommendation].
Overall, these changes would make a real difference for [group].
In summary, the recommendations above would lead to a better experience for [group].

community.title: Community Report
community.purpose: Reports on community facilities, services, or local initiatives.

introduction.label: A: Introduction
introduction.purpose: Introduce the community issue or initiative.
phrases: The aim of this report is to assess [community facility/service] and suggest improvements.
This report looks at [topic] in the local area and how it affects residents.
The purpose of this report is to evaluate [facility/service] for the community.
This report provides an overview of [issue], focusing on what people think and what could be improved.

sources.label: B: Sources/Context
sources.purpose: Explain how community information was gathered.
phrases: The report is based on feedback from local residents and my own observations.
The information was collected through a short survey of [residents/users].
The findings come from comments shared during [meeting/event] and informal feedback.
This report is based on interviews with [community members] and questionnaire results.

general_praising_criticising.label: C: General View / Praising / Criticising
general_praising_criticising.purpose: Present overall community impressions, strengths, and concerns.
phrases: Overall, most residents felt that [facility/service] was [positive/negative].
On the whole, people were satisfied with [aspect].
One strong point is that [positive].
The highlight for many people was [best part].
However, a common complaint was [problem].
One major concern was [issue], mainly because [reason].
[aspect] is not ideal, especially for [group] when [situation].
This seems to be caused by [cause], which leads to [result].

recommendation.label: D: Recommendation
phrases: To improve this, it would be a good idea to [action].
One simple change would be to [suggestion].
Local authorities should consider [recommendation] to address [issue].
If this change is made, it would benefit residents by [benefit].
Another option would be to [alternative], which could improve [aspect].
A practical step would be to [step], leading to [positive result].

conclusion.label: E: Conclusion
phrases: In conclusion, [facility/service] is useful overall, but [area] needs improvement.
To sum up, the main strengths are [strengths], while the biggest issue is [issue].
Taking everything into account, the most important improvement would be [key recommendation].
Overall, these changes would make a real difference to residents.
In summary, the recommendations above would improve life in the community.

phrases: To improve this, it would be a good idea to [action].
